content:
I'm staring this thread for people to add their tools for others to play with (if they happen to be web-based). I know some of you have posted tools on the stream previously, but I figured a consolidated topic would make them easier to find:
http://smartqedit4.azurewebsites.net/Questionnaire (@Brian Postlethwaite's tool

Demo app using LHC-Forms (open-source form renderer): https://lhcforms.nlm.nih.gov/sdc
Documentation for the open-source form rendering package: http://lhncbc.github.io/lforms/
NLM Form builder (also open source): https://lhcformbuilder.nlm.nih.gov/
FHIRPower Tools - will post the link as soon the DNS updates are done. Happy to show the QDesigner tomorrow.

Opensource questionnaire builder and renderer implemented with React and TypeScript
http://ui.hl7.beda.software/
Source code is here https://github.com/beda-software/sdc-hl7-sydney/tree/master/frontend
The new version of SDC application backend moved to a separated repository https://github.com/beda-software/aidbox-sdc/
By the way, there's an 'official' repository of tools that support SDC here - https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/SDC+Implementations
Feel free to add your tool - or provide the information and I can do it for you
shouldn't this confluence page include a column for which SDC actors the software implements?

In preparation for the upcoming connectathon, could anyone who has Questionnaire tools that others can use (non necessarily open source) please add the information to https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/SDC+Implementations? We are planning a presentation (still being scheduled) focused on an overview of the SDC Implementation Guide and although there will little time for demos (at least in that presentation) I would like to at least point people toward available tools.
@Brian Postlethwaite @Stoyan Halkaliev @Ilya Beda ? If you would like your tools on the tool list, please add them to https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/SDC+Implementations. (Thanks.)
Hi @Paul Lynch I somehow missed the previous post. I have just added my tools to the confluence page.
